CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ethel Allen, housewife, 2812 Webster Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 6, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that too much leniency is shown teenagers who commit crimes?" answer reads: "Yes, I do. But I don't know how they should be handled.  I think however, that they should receive the punishment which goes with the crime."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ethel Allen wearing light colored coat seated behind steering wheel of car with rain on windows
